title: Between Gotham and Matinee
content:
Hi all, my first post here.

I'd like to find a font that reflects the typographic style often used in 1940-1950 european advertising, such as phillips and electrolux. I'm looking at somthing between Gotham and Matinee, Gotham being too sharp and Matinee to smooth and Matinee-like (naturally). Also found in American aviation/war-like prints from the 1940's.

Could anyone point me in the right direction?

Thanks  
David
author: monc

comments.content:
Hej David,  
I assume you’re talking about [FF Matinee Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_matinee_gothic_exp/). (And btw, here’s a [link to Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_history.php?historyItemID=1&productLineID=100008), too.)

Samples really would help.  
Something like this: [Philips poster from 1951](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.internationalposter.com/poster-details.aspx?id=DUL15660) by [A. M. Cassandre](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/typophile.com/wiki/A.%20M.%20Cassandre)? — [Corinthian Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/corinthian/bold-condensed/), [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/bold/), [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/neufville/futura-nd/familytree.html).

Or rather this: [17eme Salon Internationale de l'Aviation, 1946](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.internationalposter.com/poster-details.aspx?id=FRL15110) by [Paul Colin](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Paul%20Colin)? — [Rhode](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=rhode&site=d&sample_text=L%E2%80%99AVIATION/), [Denim Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/denim/denim-black-32740/)/ [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/helvetica_lt_std_ultra_compressed_ot/?sample_text=SALON%20INTERNATIONAL), [MT Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/monotype_grotesque_condensed/?sample_text=SALON%20INTERNATIONAL).

[Swissair, 1948](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.internationalposter.com/poster-details.aspx?id=SWL16382) by Bernhard Reber? — [Tasse](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Tasse)/ [Topic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/urw_topic/) ( [more](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18227)), [Liquorstore Jazz](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/liquorstore/jazz/).

F
